translated: In a clean and true place, one should visualize a moon maṇḍala arisen from the letter A in one's heart.

analyzed: de'i steng du yi ge hr'i: dkar po'o ;
translated: Upon that, the white letter Hri.

original: / de'i 'od zer gyis bskul la mdun @175b gyi nam mkha' la bla ma dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa spyan drangs la /
analyzed: / de'i 'od zer gyis bskul la mdun @175b gyi nam mkha' la bla ma dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa spyan drangs la /
translated: Inviting with the light rays, the guru, buddhas, bodhisattvas, etc. are invited into the space in front.

original: snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer las byung ba'i mchod pa'i sprin gyis legs par mchod cing sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa dang / tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi bsgom pa yang bya ste /
analyzed: snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer las byung ba'i mchod pa'i sprin gyis legs par mchod cing sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa dang / tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi bsgom pa yang bya ste /
translated: Having made offerings with the cloud of offerings arisen from the light rays of the seed syllable in the heart, one should confess misdeeds and so forth, and also meditate on the four immeasurables.

original: de nas stong pa nyid bsgom par bya zhing /
analyzed: de nas stong pa nyid bsgom par bya zhing /
translated: Then one should meditate on emptiness.

original: aom stong pa nyid kyi ye shes rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid ni nga yin no zhes bya ba 'dis byin gyis brlab par bya ba'o //
analyzed: aom stong pa nyid kyi ye shes rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid ni nga yin no zhes bya ba 'dis byin gyis brlab par bya ba'o //
translated: One should bless oneself with the words, I am the nature of the vajra of the exalted wisdom of emptiness.

original: de'i rjes la sngar bzhin du yi ge hr'i: rnam par bsgoms la nam mkha'i dkyil na spros shing bsdu bar yang byas la /
analyzed: de'i rjes la sngar bzhin du yi ge hr'i: rnam par bsgoms la nam mkha'i dkyil na spros shing bsdu bar yang byas la /
translated: After that, as before, one should meditate on the syllable hriḥ, and having emanated and reabsorbed it into the middle of the sky,

original: de las nges par byung ba'i 'jig rten dbang phyug tu bdag nyid bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: de las nges par byung ba'i 'jig rten dbang phyug tu bdag nyid bsgom par bya ste /
translated: one should meditate on oneself as Avalokiteśvara, arisen from that.

original: dkar po 'od zer bye ba 'phro ba ral pa dang / dbu rgyun dang ldan pa /
analyzed: dkar po 'od zer bye ba 'phro ba ral pa dang / dbu rgyun dang ldan pa /
translated: He is white, radiating ten million light rays, with hair and topknot,

original: snang ba mtha' yas kyis spyi bor mtshan pa /
analyzed: snang ba mtha' yas kyis spyi bor mtshan pa /
translated: marked on the crown of the head with Amitābha,

original: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
translated: adorned with all the ornaments,

original: bzhin 'dzum pa /
analyzed: bzhin 'dzum pa /
translated: smiling,

original: skyil krung phyed pas padma dang zla ba'i gdan la bzhugs pa /
analyzed: skyil krung phyed pas padma dang zla ba'i gdan la bzhugs pa /
translated: seated in half-lotus posture on a seat of a lotus and moon,

original: g-yas pas mchog sbyin pa /
analyzed: g-yas pas mchog sbyin pa /
translated: bestowing the gift of protection with the right hand,

original: g-yon pas padma bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon pas padma bsnams pa'o //
translated: and holding a lotus with the left.

original: g-yas kyi phyogs na 'phags ma sgrol ma dang / gzhon nu nor bzangs gnyis so //
analyzed: g-yas kyi phyogs na 'phags ma sgrol ma dang / gzhon nu nor bzangs gnyis so //
translated: To the right are Noble Tārā and the youth Sudhana.

original: g-yon gyi phyogs na khro gnyer can dang / rta mgrin gnyis so //
analyzed: g-yon gyi phyogs na khro gnyer can dang / rta mgrin gnyis so //
translated: To the left are Akṣobhya and Hayagrīva.

original: de nas mgo bo la yi ge aom mgrin par yi ge a'a: snying gar yi ge h'um 'di dag rnams legs par bsams la /
analyzed: de nas mgo bo la yi ge aom mgrin par yi ge a'a: snying gar yi ge h'um 'di dag rnams legs par bsams la /
translated: Then, on the head is the syllable oṃ, in the throat is the syllable āḥ, and in the heart is the syllable hūṃ.

original: ji srid du skyo bar ma gyur gyi bar du gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid du skyo bar ma gyur gyi bar du gnas par bya'o //
translated: One should remain in this visualization as long as one does not become weary.

original: skyo ba dang sngags bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: skyo ba dang sngags bzlas par bya'o //
translated: When one becomes weary, one should recite the mantra.

original: de la sngags ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la sngags ni 'di yin te /
translated: The mantra is as follows:

original: aom hr'i: sv'a h'a bya ba'o //
analyzed: aom hr'i: sv'a h'a bya ba'o //
translated: oṃ hrīḥ svāhā.

original: kharsa pa ni'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: kharsa pa ni'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so /
translated: The sādhana of Khasarpāṇa is complete.
